qas.question: What physical factor must be continuously monitored during temperature studies>
At what time does the average adult human reach his lowest temperature?
How long before wake time is the lowest temperature reached?
When does the temperature of morning type young adults reach its lowest?
What is the time of lowest temperature for evening type young adults?
What physical factor must be periodicly monitored in temperature studies?
What do evening types reach at 4:00 a.m?
What occurs close to waking for morning types?
Who reaches their minimum temperature in the middle of their waking hours?

context: For temperature studies, subjects must remain awake but calm and semi-reclined in near darkness while their <b5_0>rectal <a0_0>temperatures<b5_0/><a0_0/> are taken continuously. Though variation is great among normal chronotypes, the average human adult's temperature reaches its minimum at about <a1_0>05:00<a1_0/> (5 a.m.), about <a2_0>two hours<a2_0/> before habitual wake time. Baehr et al. found that, in young adults, the daily <b6_0><b7_0>body temperature minimum<b7_0/><b6_0/> occurred at about <a3_0>04:00<a3_0/> (4 a.m.) for morning types but at about <a4_0>06:00<a4_0/> (6 a.m.) for evening types. This minimum occurred at approximately the middle of the eight hour sleep period for <b8_0>morning types<b8_0/>, but closer to waking in evening types.
